channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Imitrob: Imitation Learning Dataset for Training and Evaluating 6D Object Pose Estimators
item.description: This paper introduces a dataset for training and evaluating methods for 6D pose estimation of hand-held tools in task demonstrations captured by a standard RGB camera.

item.title: Serialized Interacting Mixed Membership Stochastic Block Model
item.description: In this work, we show that these models are all special cases of a single global framework: the Serialized Interacting Mixed membership Stochastic Block Model (SIMSBM).

item.title: IoT Data Analytics in Dynamic Environments: From An Automated Machine Learning Perspective
item.description: Machine Learning (ML) approaches have shown their capacity for IoT data analytics.

item.title: ImDrug: A Benchmark for Deep Imbalanced Learning in AI-aided Drug Discovery
item.description: The last decade has witnessed a prosperous development of computational methods and dataset curation for AI-aided drug discovery (AIDD).

item.title: A Multi-turn Machine Reading Comprehension Framework with Rethink Mechanism for Emotion-Cause Pair Extraction
item.description: Our framework can model complicated relations between emotions and causes while avoiding generating the pairing matrix (the leading cause of the label sparsity problem).

item.title: M$^2$DQN: A Robust Method for Accelerating Deep Q-learning Network
item.description: Deep Q-learning Network (DQN) is a successful way which combines reinforcement learning with deep neural networks and leads to a widespread application of reinforcement learning.

item.title: Causes of Catastrophic Forgetting in Class-Incremental Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Therefore, in a set of experiments and representational analyses, we demonstrate that the semantic shift of the background class and a bias towards new classes are the major causes of forgetting in CiSS.

item.title: Enhance the Visual Representation via Discrete Adversarial Training
item.description: For borrowing the advantage from NLP-style AT, we propose Discrete Adversarial Training (DAT).

item.title: Automatic Tumor Segmentation via False Positive Reduction Network for Whole-Body Multi-Modal PET/CT Images
item.description: In this study, we introduce a false positive reduction network to overcome this limitation.

item.title: PINEAPPLE: Personifying INanimate Entities by Acquiring Parallel Personification data for Learning Enhanced generation
item.description: To this end, we propose PINEAPPLE: Personifying INanimate Entities by Acquiring Parallel Personification data for Learning Enhanced generation.

item.title: A Deep Moving-camera Background Model
item.description: Moreover, existing MCBMs usually model the background either on the domain of a typically-large panoramic image or in an online fashion.

item.title: MetaMask: Revisiting Dimensional Confounder for Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: As a successful approach to self-supervised learning, contrastive learning aims to learn invariant information shared among distortions of the input sample.

item.title: 3D VSG: Long-term Semantic Scene Change Prediction through 3D Variable Scene Graphs
item.description: In this work, we formalize the task of semantic scene variability estimation and identify three main varieties of semantic scene change: changes in the position of an object, its semantic state, or the composition of a scene as a whole.

item.title: Modeling Multiple Views via Implicitly Preserving Global Consistency and Local Complementarity
item.description: To this end, we propose a methodology, specifically consistency and complementarity network (CoCoNet), which avails of strict global inter-view consistency and local cross-view complementarity preserving regularization to comprehensively learn representations from multiple views.

item.title: GATraj: A Graph- and Attention-based Multi-Agent Trajectory Prediction Model
item.description: Our model achieves performance on par with the state-of-the-art models at a much higher prediction speed tested on multiple open datasets.

item.title: Estimation of Optical Aberrations in 3D Microscopic Bioimages
item.description: To this end, our method incorporates object-specific information into the simulated images used for training the network.

item.title: Whole-Body Lesion Segmentation in 18F-FDG PET/CT
item.description: There has been growing research interest in using deep learning based method to achieve fully automated segmentation of lesion in Positron emission tomography computed tomography(PET CT) scans for the prognosis of various cancers.

item.title: Multiscale Adaptive Scheduling and Path-Planning for Power-Constrained UAV-Relays via SMDPs
item.description: We describe the orchestration of a decentralized swarm of rotary-wing UAV-relays, augmenting the coverage and service capabilities of a terrestrial base station.

item.title: A Comprehensive Benchmark for COVID-19 Predictive Modeling Using Electronic Health Records in Intensive Care: Choosing the Best Model for COVID-19 Prognosis
item.description: Many deep learning models have been proposed to conduct clinical predictive tasks such as mortality prediction for COVID-19 patients in intensive care units using Electronic Health Record (EHR) data.

item.title: FairGBM: Gradient Boosting with Fairness Constraints
item.description: Machine Learning (ML) algorithms based on gradient boosted decision trees (GBDT) are still favored on many tabular data tasks across various mission critical applications, from healthcare to finance.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation via Progressive Patch Learning
item.description: "Progressive Patch Learning" further extends the feature destruction and patch learning to multi-level granularities in a progressive manner.

item.title: Selecting Stickers in Open-Domain Dialogue through Multitask Learning
item.description: With the increasing popularity of online chatting, stickers are becoming important in our online communication.

item.title: A Mosquito is Worth 16x16 Larvae: Evaluation of Deep Learning Architectures for Mosquito Larvae Classification
item.description: This research introduces the application of the Vision Transformer (ViT) in a comparative study to improve image classification on Aedes and Culex larvae.

item.title: Game-theoretic Objective Space Planning
item.description: Autonomous Racing awards agents that react to opponents' behaviors with agile maneuvers towards progressing along the track while penalizing both over-aggressive and over-conservative agents.

item.title: Expansion and Shrinkage of Localization for Weakly-Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: To tackle with this issue, this paper proposes an Expansion and Shrinkage scheme based on the offset learning in the deformable convolution, to sequentially improve the recall and precision of the located object in the two respective stages.

item.title: SRFeat: Learning Locally Accurate and Globally Consistent Non-Rigid Shape Correspondence
item.description: In this work, we present a novel learning-based framework that combines the local accuracy of contrastive learning with the global consistency of geometric approaches, for robust non-rigid matching.

item.title: Self-Supervised Learning with an Information Maximization Criterion
item.description: In this article, we argue that a straightforward application of information maximization among alternative latent representations of the same input naturally solves the collapse problem and achieves competitive empirical results.

item.title: Omni-Dimensional Dynamic Convolution
item.description: Learning a single static convolutional kernel in each convolutional layer is the common training paradigm of modern Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs).

item.title: Reducing Variance in Temporal-Difference Value Estimation via Ensemble of Deep Networks
item.description: On a set of 26 benchmark Atari environments, MeanQ outperforms all tested baselines, including the best available baseline, SUNRISE, at 100K interaction steps in 16/26 environments, and by 68% on average.

item.title: Less is Better: Recovering Intended-Feature Subspace to Robustify NLU Models
item.description: When delving into a lower manifold to remove redundancies, RISK reveals that an extremely low-dimensional subspace with intended features can robustly represent the highly biased dataset.

item.title: Deliberated Domain Bridging for Domain Adaptive Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In this work, we resort to data mixing to establish a deliberated domain bridging (DDB) for DASS, through which the joint distributions of source and target domains are aligned and interacted with each in the intermediate space.

item.title: Hybrid Window Attention Based Transformer Architecture for Brain Tumor Segmentation
item.description: As intensities of MRI volumes are inconsistent across institutes, it is essential to extract universal features of multi-modal MRIs to precisely segment brain tumors.

item.title: SeqOT: A Spatial-Temporal Transformer Network for Place Recognition Using Sequential LiDAR Data
item.description: It uses multi-scale transformers to generate a global descriptor for each sequence of LiDAR range images in an end-to-end fashion.

item.title: On the Robustness of Graph Neural Diffusion to Topology Perturbations
item.description: In this work, we explore the robustness properties of graph neural PDEs.

item.title: Skill Extraction from Job Postings using Weak Supervision
item.description: Aggregated data obtained from job postings provide powerful insights into labor market demands, and emerging skills, and aid job matching.

item.title: Learning Pair Potentials using Differentiable Simulations
item.description: We show that our methods can be used to simultaneously fit potentials for simulations at different compositions and temperatures to improve the transferability of the learned potentials.

item.title: One-Shot Synthesis of Images and Segmentation Masks
item.description: To this end, inspired by the recent architectural developments of single-image GANs, we introduce our OSMIS model which enables the synthesis of segmentation masks that are precisely aligned to the generated images in the one-shot regime.

item.title: CommunityLM: Probing Partisan Worldviews from Language Models
item.description: As political attitudes have diverged ideologically in the United States, political speech has diverged lingusitically.

item.title: Neural Stochastic Control
item.description: These two stochastic controllers thus are complementary in applications.

item.title: DEQGAN: Learning the Loss Function for PINNs with Generative Adversarial Networks
item.description: Solutions to differential equations are of significant scientific and engineering relevance.

item.title: PIZZA: A Powerful Image-only Zero-Shot Zero-CAD Approach to 6 DoF Tracking
item.description: Our results on challenging datasets are on par with previous works that require much more information (training images of the target objects, 3D models, and/or depth data).

item.title: 4DenoiseNet: Adverse Weather Denoising from Adjacent Point Clouds
item.description: Reliable point cloud data is essential for perception tasks \textit{e. g.} in robotics and autonomous driving applications.

item.title: Cold-Start Data Selection for Few-shot Language Model Fine-tuning: A Prompt-Based Uncertainty Propagation Approach
item.description: We propose PATRON, a new method that uses prompt-based uncertainty estimation for data selection for pre-trained language model fine-tuning under cold-start scenarios, i. e., no initial labeled data are available.

item.title: CLIPping Privacy: Identity Inference Attacks on Multi-Modal Machine Learning Models
item.description: As deep learning is now used in many real-world applications, research has focused increasingly on the privacy of deep learning models and how to prevent attackers from obtaining sensitive information about the training data.

item.title: Constrained Update Projection Approach to Safe Policy Optimization
item.description: Compared to previous safe RL methods, CUP enjoys the benefits of 1) CUP generalizes the surrogate functions to generalized advantage estimator (GAE), leading to strong empirical performance.

item.title: Knowledge Is Flat: A Seq2Seq Generative Framework for Various Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: To remedy the KG structure information loss from the "flat" text, we further improve the input representations of entities and relations, and the inference algorithm in KG-S2S.

item.title: AssembleRL: Learning to Assemble Furniture from Their Point Clouds
item.description: The rise of simulation environments has enabled learning-based approaches for assembly planning, which is otherwise a labor-intensive and daunting task.

item.title: Multi-Modal Masked Autoencoders for Medical Vision-and-Language Pre-Training
item.description: Besides, we conduct further analysis to better verify the effectiveness of different components of our approach and various settings of pre-training.

item.title: iFlipper: Label Flipping for Individual Fairness
item.description: We then propose an approximate linear programming algorithm and provide theoretical guarantees on how close its result is to the optimal solution in terms of the number of label flips.

item.title: Toward an understanding of the properties of neural network approaches for supernovae light curve approximation
item.description: The modern time-domain photometric surveys collect a lot of observations of various astronomical objects, and the coming era of large-scale surveys will provide even more information.
